intro: Bidens reptans var. bipartita, commonly known as the two-lobed ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardens.
